{{Use British English|date=June 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Trevoh Chalobah | image = TrevohChalobahIpsBlR1.jpg | image_size = | caption = Trevoh Chalobah on his professional league debut for [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] | fullname = Trevoh Tom Chalobah{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/698775|title=Premier League clubs publish retained lists|date=8 June 2018|accessdate=14 August 2018|publisher=Premier League}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1999|7|5|df=y}}{{Soccerway|trevoh-chalobah/376695}} | birth_place = [[Freetown]], Sierra Leone | height = {{convert|1.90|m|ftin|order=flip}}{{cite web|url=https://www.itfc.co.uk/teams/first-team/midfielder/trevoh-chalobah2/|title=Trevoh Chalobah - Midfielder - First Team - Ipswich Town|accessdate=30 November 2018|website=itfc.co.uk}} | position = [[Midfielder]] / [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 6 | youthyears1 = 2016–2018 | youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | youthyears2 = | youthclubs2 = | years1 = 2018– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1= 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = → [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] (loan) | caps2 = 30 | goals2 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 15 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2016–2018 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 25 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2018– | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 15:43, 12 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 22:22, 19 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Trevoh Tom Chalobah''' (born 5 July 1999) is an English professional footballer who plays for [[EFL Championship]] club [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Born in [[Freetown]], [[Sierra Leone]], Chalobah signed his first professional contract with Chelsea in June 2016 and signed a new contract in March 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2018/03/chalobah-commits.html|title=Chalobah commits|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|accessdate=20 May 2018}} His youth honours at Chelsea include the [[UEFA Youth League]] in 2015–16, the [[FA Youth Cup]] in 2015–16 and 2016–17, and the [[Professional Development League|Under-18 Premier League]] in 2016–17.{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/trevoh-chalobah-enjoys-danceoff-with-brother-nathaniel-as-chelsea-under18s-celebrate-fa-youth-cup-a3525231.html?amp|title=Chalobah brothers perform dance-off after FA Youth Cup win|work=London Evening Standard|accessdate=20 May 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/04/28/who-are-chelseas-fa-youth-cup-winning-stars/trevoh-chalobah/|title=Who are Chelsea's FA Youth Cup winning stars?|work=The Daily Telegraph|accessdate=20 May 2018}} He was named by [[Antonio Conte]] as a substitute for the [[2018 FA Cup Final]] victory against [[Manchester United]] on 19 May 2018 at [[Wembley Stadium]] despite never having previously played a professional game.{{cite web|url=https://www.talksport.com/football/chelsea-news-who-trevoh-chalobah-youngster-bench-fa-cup-final?amp|title=Chelsea FC news: Who is Trevoh Chalobah, Blues youngster on bench for FA Cup final|first=Billy|last=Hawkins|date=19 May 2018|publisher=Talksport|accessdate=20 May 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/962290/Chelsea-team-news-Blues-name-shock-player-not-in-FA-Cup-programme/amp|title=Chelsea team news: Blues name shock player NO-ONE knows... he's not in FA Cup programme – Football|work=Daily Express|accessdate=20 May 2018}} Chelsea won the match 1–0, and Chalobah did not enter the field. ====Ipswich Town (loan)==== He signed for [[EFL Championship]] club [[Ipswich Town]] on a season-long loan deal in June 2018,{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44606798|title=Trevoh Chalobah: Chelsea's England youth international joins Ipswich Town on loan|date=25 June 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}} and made his professional debut on 4 August, starting in a 2–2 draw with [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]].{{cite web |title=Chelsea’s great defensive talent makes impressive senior debut |url=https://www.chelsea-news.co/2018/08/vide-chelseas-great-defensive-talent-makes-impressive-senior-debut/ |website=Chelsea News |accessdate=7 August 2018 |date=7 August 2018}}{{cite news |last1=Salt |first1=Nathan |title=How did Premier League loan stars get on in the Football League? |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-6031199/As-Mason-Mount-scores-Derby-did-Premier-League-loan-stars-fare-Football-League.html |accessdate=7 August 2018 |work=Daily Mail |date=6 August 2018}} Two weeks later he scored his first goal, equalising in a 1–1 draw with [[Aston Villa]] at [[Portman Road]].{{cite news |title=Ipswich Town 1–1 Aston Villa |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45152569 |accessdate=18 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 August 2018}} ==International career== He has represented England at youth level from Under-16 up to Under-19, captaining all three teams at various stages. In November 2014, Chalobah captained the [[England national under-16 football team|England under-16 team]] against [[Scotland national under-16 football team|Scotland]] in the [[Victory Shield]].{{cite news |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/nov/20/england-u16-scotland-victory-shield-report |title=England U16s see off Scotland in Victory Shield encounter|first=Jamie |last=Bradbury |publisher=The Football Association |date=20 November 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2018}} In May 2016, Chalobah was captain of the [[England national under-17 football team|England under-17 team]] that lost to [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain]] in the quarter-final of the [[2016 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]].{{cite news |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/may/15/spain-england-report-150516 |title=England Under-17s miss out on semi-final after loss to Spain|first=Peter |last=Maxwell |publisher=The Football Association |date=15 May 2016 |accessdate=25 October 2018}} Chalobah was included in the [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19]] squad for the [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]].{{cite news |title=Young Lions squad for U19 Euro|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/jun/26/england-u19-squad-for-euros-260617 |accessdate=25 October 2018 |publisher=The Football Association |date=26 June 2017}} An ankle injury sustained in the final group game against [[Germany national youth football team#Germany national under-19 squad|Germany]] ruled him out for the rest of the tournament.{{cite news |title=Same again please|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/jul/11/euro-u19-semi-final-preview-110717 |accessdate=25 October 2018 |publisher=The Football Association |date=11 July 2017}} England went on to defeat [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal]] in the final.{{cite web|title=European Under-19 Championship: England beat Portugal in final|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40619862|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 July 2017|accessdate=25 October 2018}} ==Personal life== His brother [[Nathaniel Chalobah]] is also a professional footballer; he has played for Chelsea and [[S.S.C. Napoli]] and is now at [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].{{cite web|url=https://www.football.london/chelsea-fc/players/chelsea-wonderkids-abramovich-ampadu-chalobah-14257525|title=The Chelsea wonderkids Abramovich must not ignore this summer|first=Oliver|last=Harbord|date=19 April 2018|website=Football.london|accessdate=20 May 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 10 February 2019}} {| class=wikitable style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|[[FA Cup]] !colspan=2|[[EFL Cup]] !colspan=2|Other !colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan=3|[[Chelsea F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Chelsea U23]] |[[2016–17 Chelsea F.C. season|2016–17]] |colspan=3|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||2{{efn|Appearances in [[EFL Trophy]]|name=EFLT}}||0||2||0 |- |[[2017–18 Chelsea F.C. season|2017–18]] |colspan=3|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||6{{efn|name=EFLT}}||0||6||0 |- !colspan="4"|Total !colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—!!8!!0!!8!!0 |- |[[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Ipswich Town F.C. season|2018–19]] |[[EFL Championship|Championship]] |30||2||0||0||1||0||colspan=2|—||31||2 |- !colspan=3|Career total !30!!2!!0!!0!!1!!0!!8!!0!!39!!2 |} {{notelist}} ==Honours== '''Chelsea''' *[[FA Cup]]: [[2017–18 FA Cup|2017–18]]{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44091559 |title=Chelsea 1–0 Manchester United |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 May 2018 |accessdate=19 May 2018}} '''England U19''' *[[UEFA European Under-19 Championship]]: [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2017]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Soccerbase|96784|Trevoh Chalobah}} {{Ipswich Town F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chalobah, Trevoh}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1999 births]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Freetown]] [[Category:English footballers]] [[Category:Sierra Leonean footballers]] [[Category:Chelsea F.C. players]] [[Category:Ipswich Town F.C. players]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:England youth international footballers]] [[Category:English Football League players]] [[Category:Sierra Leonean emigrants to the United Kingdom]]
